body:
I would like to see a `--verbose` flag added to `spack test run`.

### Rationale

Currently, the output of `spack test run` looks like:
```
$ spack test run py-setuptools
==> Spack test a3k3zuqk77j6a43f3uov7cmg2f37ys4m
==> Testing package py-setuptools-44.1.0-3tupt4p
==> Testing package py-setuptools-50.1.0-y52kezl
==> Testing package py-setuptools-50.1.0-gfu263a
==> Testing package py-setuptools-50.1.0-6aovrq4
==> Testing package py-setuptools-50.1.0-75gs77c
==> Testing package py-setuptools-50.3.2-nvkcvji
==> Testing package py-setuptools-50.3.2-pidod5m
```
I think by default, we should add a summary at the end, like pytest does. Something like `7 out of 7 tests PASSED`. I would also like a `--verbose` flag that shows more details of the tests for each package.
title: spack test run --verbose
